results.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
results.description:
OccamSec is a leading provider in the world of cybersecurity. Our clients rely on us to provide information security services that exceed current industry standards. We provide accurate, actionable information to reduce risk and enable better informed decisions. Our unique end-to-end solutions detect, identify, respond, and protect in order to maximize the effectiveness of our clients' security programs.

We are looking to hire Full Stack Software Engineers in the United States¬†to be part of a green field product. The product is for an intelligence gathering and analysis platform, collecting complex data sets using a combination of open source and in house tooling to provide meaningful information to our penetration testing teams. We're looking for a range of skills and knowledge, as the project spans the disciplines of security and development. The existing services use Django Python and React JavaScript being hosted upon AWS, with many more services to build.


Responsibilities

At OccamSec, we're looking for developers who have an appetite for learning, an interest in cyber security and strong communication skills. You will be taking part in designing and implementing solutions and tooling for the intelligence gathering platform, with strong collaboration between the penetration and engineering teams to ensure the tools built are effective and provide meaningful information for our assessment teams in the field.

Interest in picking up or experience with different languages is therefore a plus.

Experience with the following or similar technologies:

  • Python (Django Rest Framework)
  • JavaScript (React)

results.title: Data Analyst
results.description:
Data Analyst

We‚Äôre building a more open society. Want to help?

OpenCorporates is the largest source of open company data in the world with over 200 million companies in our database. We firmly believe delivering genuine corporate transparency benefits both business and society. Our vision to become the world‚Äôs foundational and definitive source of company data.

Corporate transparency enables citizens, companies and governments to make clearer choices about who they do business with. It throttles crime, helps protect workers and our environment. It oils the wheels of prosperity, fairness and sustainability.

OpenCorporates was conceived to drive that change. We‚Äôve worked with bodies like the World Bank and the G20 to spearhead initiatives such as the Open Company Data Index and the creation of the Global Legal Entity Identifier Foundation. Our expertise has shaped how the US Federal Government procures services; we have advised the European Commission on the EU Open Data Directive; and we were instrumental in the UK Companies House opening access to their company data.

Our platform dynamically captures and curates the records of over 200 million companies from 140 jurisdictions around the world ‚Äî openly available information that is the foundation to sourcing, risk, compliance, and investigations processes for organisations around the world ‚Äî large and small, public and private.

To help our rapidly growing user base derive greater insights from our data, we‚Äôre solving hard-core ‚Äòbig-data‚Äô challenges: modelling, linking, profiling, cleaning and presenting actionable results from billions of data entities. We‚Äôre also establishing a globally scalable cloud infrastructure that can run these processes efficiently and reliably at scale; and serve our global audience via an ecosystem to rival AWS for ease of use and integration.

¬†

Our four company values outline the shared principles that define our culture and drive our success: we are bold, we are one team, we learn & adapt and we put our users first. Whether through day-to-day decision making, teamwork, supporting our clients or evaluating performance, the values are the lens we look through to help us achieve great things.

OpenCorporates operates an informal hybrid model around our London workspace. Working from home is the norm and in-person touchpoints are expected to become more frequent.


The Role:

The Data Analyst will report to the Head of Data Science and be responsible for analysing complex datasets of corporate registry information, supporting OpenCorporates various data science initiatives. Technical experience is useful but skills can always be learned, so the ideal candidate will demonstrate a high aptitude for learning and problem solving, as well as being comfortable working independently on various data tasks.

Your typical responsibilities will include:

  • Analyse internal corporate registry data to identify trends, patterns, and insights

Requirements:

results.title: Senior QA Test Automation Engineer
results.description:
Description

We are ElectroNeek

ElectroNeek empowers IT Service Providers to bring complex Hyperautomation technologies to 200M+ small and medium-size clients with no-code tools, partner-centric support, and disruptive business models. With customers ranging from boutiques and newcomers in the automation-as-a-service industry to established market players like Xerox, Compasso, and Ricoh, ElectroNeek provides best-in-class services including ultimate GTM support by vendors.

Role description

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior QA Test Automation Engineer on a full-time remote basis who will be working with Desktop and Web applications & latest emerging technologies. You will be reporting to the QA Manager and will be part of an international remote team.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze applications and systems;¬†identify areas for test automation.
  • Investigate and define a proper approach to cover higher-risk scenarios with autotests.
  • Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases.
  • Implement test plans, automation, and validation strategies for Web applications and Services.

results.title: Intermediate UX Designer
results.description:
Location: Remote

Work anywhere in the US, must live in the US

We are growing! Join an Agile technology team of 35+ talented product managers, developers, test engineers, project managers, UX designers, etc. who support a company of ~150 people with industry-leading web applications in areas of subscription-based continuing education, simulation and training, eCommerce, content management, and more.

ABOUT THE COMPANY
A leader in online education, Continued is composed of passionate individuals dedicated to providing an exceptional learning experience that enhances the lives and careers of the professionals we serve. We are fast-paced, nimble, and laugh a lot. We all work from home offices in various locations across the country. We are dynamic, engaged, highly motivated, and highly skilled. We are passionate about our work and our professions and we're looking for another team member to join our cause. We are certified as a great workplace, ranked #100 in Fortune's 2022 Best Small & Medium Workplaces for Millennials, ranked #86 in Fortune's 2021 top 100 Medium-Sized Workplaces in the US and ranked #13 in Fortune's 2020 top 25 Small & Medium Workplaces for Women by the independent analysts at Great Place to Work¬Æ. Learn more about us at continued.com.

We celebrate diverse voices within our organization and in the professions we serve, and we welcome and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds. We strive to be an inclusive workplace where our team members feel empowered and supported in their careers. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religious creed, disability status, veteran status or age. We are also committed to paying our team members at fair rates based on their skills and experience.

ABOUT THE TEAM

Though we are virtual and scattered across the country, we communicate frequently, have a tight-knit team, and support each other across roles and projects. We are driven by endless curiosity, a love of learning, and a desire to solve problems.

ABOUT THE POSITION

As a UX Designer at Continued, you'll be responsible for translating research and insights into delightful user experiences. You'll work closely with other designers, product managers, stakeholders, and developers to help shape the future of our products. On a typical day, you'll spend time designing in Figma, validating your designs in Maze, organizing your work in Jira, attending Agile ceremonies via Zoom, and carrying on plenty of chats in Slack.¬†

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design usable, accessible, data-driven, and engaging user experiences for mobile and web
  • Conduct interviews with key stakeholders to create user stories, personas, and storyboards
  • Deliver design work, including discovery artifacts, sketches and rough prototypes, wireframes, UX flows, and high fidelity prototypes
  • Respect and contribute to the evolving design system
  • Seek to understand user behavior and motivations using qualitative and quantitative research methods
  • Engage in critiques as well as share new learnings and case studies
  • Challenge existing processes with new ways for the team to be more effective

REQUIREMENTS

  • 4+ years of relevant design experience required - looking for intermediate level of experience rather than junior (1-3 yrs) or senior (7+ yrs)
  • A Bachelor's is required, but a degree in a relevant field is preferred.
  • An online portfolio demonstrating experience creating user-centric design solutions (sketch, storyboard, final designs to live experiences)
  • Extensive experience using Figma, Adobe XD, Axure, or similar tools, but Figma is highly preferred.¬†

MORE ABOUT THE POSITION

  • Full-time W2 position, work core U.S. business hours in your time zone
  • Ability to fulfill the job requirements with or without reasonable accommodations
  • Work from your home office
  • Company-provided MacBook Pro, internet stipend, etc
  • Must be located in the United States and be legally eligible to work for us
  • Travel is required for an annual company meeting, and may be required once per year for team or project meetings
  • We offer comprehensive medical, dental, and vision group health insurance, flexible spending accounts, telemedicine, accident insurance, and more
  • We offer 21 days of paid time off per year as well as your birthday and national holidays and observances (you may substitute any of the standard holidays for another public holiday such as bank/school or other regional or religious holidays)
  • We offer a 401k match, professional development, charitable gift matching, robust wellness programs, and more

TO APPLY

To apply, please submit a cover letter with your application. In your cover letter, we'd love to hear about 1) why you would make a great addition to our team; and 2) a project achievement you are particularly proud of, and why.

To learn more about our team check out our About Us page on our website: https://www.hive.co/company

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
About Anonos:

Anonos is a global data privacy technology company founded in 2013. We understand that organizations want to innovate, without getting into legal hot water. We allow them to do exactly that: use their data, without the drama.

We recently raised an additional $50M in funding to combine our offerings with the German synthetic data startup Statice, to form a class-leading privacy technology platform. Our creative and brilliant team of 65 works from around the world to contribute to a data-driven future where privacy comes first. We enjoy working together and view respect, honesty, and openness as core values: this means that we appreciate the contributions and perspectives of every member of our team, and take a collaborative approach to problems. Our product, privacy research, engineering, and commercial teams work closely together to solve difficult data problems.

Join us to make a difference for organizations at the intersection of privacy, technology, and data. Learn more at https://www.anonos.com/

About the Role:

As a Sales Development Representative you are the first point of contact for potential customers and you play a key role in the success of the sales cycle at Anonos. You will work with our account executive team to source, qualify and nurture high quality leads in diverse industries, including finance, insurance, healthcare, government, and technology. Using your advanced communication and interpersonal skills, you will help prospective customers to understand our offering, and build relationships with relevant stakeholders to develop our sales pipeline. You will also work closely with the rest of the commercial team to ensure that our prospective customers have all the information they need to make informed decisions.

Responsibilities:
  • Identify, contact, qualify, and hand over high-quality (or qualified) leads from outreach campaigns, conferences, online events, and social networks to the account executive team.
  • Qualify, nurture, and hand over high-quality leads from inbound sources to the Sales team.
  • Present our company to potential clients.
  • Prepare pitches and follow-up materials for active opportunities.
  • Collect and present customer feedback to the Product and Marketing teams.

Requirements

  • Experience in a similar role in a B2B technology company. Experience in an Enterprise software company is a plus.
  • Experience in qualifying and nurturing leads to build understanding of key use cases and pain points.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in English. Professional German, French, Spanish or Italian are a plus.
  • Strong relationship-building skills.
  • Experience with relevant tools, including CRM and LinkedIn, etc.


We Value Team Members Who Are:

Smart: We appreciate the ability to learn. You have strong intellectual abilities and a proven track record of learning new skills, concepts, and technologies.

Great Communicators: You must have excellent written and verbal communication. We are looking for someone who can interact collaboratively with the C-suite, the newest software engineer, and everyone in between.

Leaders: We need people who can inspire others. You can rally team members around a challenge.

Tech-Savvy: We need people who understand how information technologies work ‚Äì and work together. You have some experience with data use cases, including analytics, data processing, or similar fields.

Entrepreneurial: Any team member has the opportunity to put forward innovative ideas. You are excited about creating new products at a start-up that is disrupting the data protection landscape.

Candid: We appreciate honesty, because we believe the best results come out of good discussions, including disagreement. You are not afraid to speak your mind, ask for more information, be honest about mistakes, and can listen carefully to the ideas of others in turn.

Kind: Kindness and a team spirit matter to us. You know how to put forward an idea respectfully, treat others with thoughtfulness, and understand how to work towards a shared goal.

Benefits

You will join an international and dedicated team in a growing company, with plenty of opportunities for impact and personal growth. We are a diverse team of curious and open-minded people, working from over 19 countries, including Germany, Belgium, the UK, and the US. Our team members benefit from:

  • Fair and competitive compensation
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Self-service learning budget
  • Support with relocation
  • Flexible work-from-home policy
  • Remote-friendly


Hiring Process
Our team is working in a remote-first fashion, and all interviews will be conducted remotely by default.

Anonos is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, genetics, disability nor age.

¬†

If you and interested and want to learn more about Anonos and the role, listen to Ben, our Director Corporate Sales and Commercial Enablement in this video.
